definition: to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: As a Bodhisattva, he would usually be standing, and dressed in jewels.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一位菩薩，他通常是站立着，穿戴着寶石。

sentences.english: S36/37Wear suitable protective clothing and gloves.
sentences.chinese: 穿戴適當的防護服和手套。

sentences.english: There are always some beggars dressed in filthly clothes hanging around the subway stations.
sentences.chinese: 在地鐵車站總有一些穿戴邋遢衣服的要飯的人停留。

sentences.english: There was a self-possessed young lady connected with these accessories;
sentences.chinese: 穿戴這些衣飾的是一個沉着鎮定的年輕女子。

sentences.english: I attempt to condense the potency of a large-scale structure into a human-sized object.
sentences.chinese: 我試圖凝聚大規模結構製作成身體可穿戴的大小。

sentences.english: She had just finished dressing when her guests came in.
sentences.chinese: 她剛剛穿戴完畢，這時她的客人進來了。

sentences.english: Executioners and judges have worn masks to avoid retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 死刑執行者及審判官也穿戴面具，預防被罪犯報復。

sentences.english: Suit up,and go to the restaurant with me.
sentences.chinese: 穿戴好，走，跟我去餐館喫飯。

sentences.english: Step Four: don all of this and realize I look like an FBI agent.
sentences.chinese: 第四步，穿戴好以後，我覺得我像個FBI探員。

sentences.english: D. Don't go on brand name; just wear those things in which u feel comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 別去追求名牌，穿戴你自己感覺舒服，合適的就好了。

sentences.english: The Spring Festival, north Korea's women wear new.
sentences.chinese: 新春佳節，朝鮮的婦女穿戴一新。

sentences.english: Some days he let her do that for him but not today it seemed.
sentences.chinese: 有時候他讓她幫他穿戴，但看起來今兒並無此打算。

sentences.english: Wearables could also be straightforward tools.
sentences.chinese: 可穿戴設備也可能是直接的工具。

sentences.english: The captain asked his men to get dressed quickly and follow him onto the deck.
sentences.chinese: 船長讓手下人快速穿戴好，跟他上甲板。

definition: to wear (as accessories)/carry at the waist
to remove/to take off/to strip off/to discard/to shed/to come off/to fall off
to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
